required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Quikin CD19-CART in Patients With r/r B-cell Lymphoma
clinical_study.official_title: a Safety and Efficacy Evaluation of Quikin CD19-CART in Patients With Relapse/Refractory B-cell Lymphoma

collaborator.agency: Second Xiangya Hospital of Central South University

brief_summary.textblock: This is a non-randomized, open label, single-site, dose-escalation study in up to 50 participants with relapse/refractory B-ALL and NHL. This study aims to evaluate the safety and efficacy of the treatment with Quikin CD19-CART.

detailed_description.textblock: Quikin CD19-CART is a kind of chimeric antigen T cell targeting CD19 with both CD19-CAR gene integration and also PD1 knockout by one-step gene-editing. After completion of study treatment, subject participation for this study will be followed up to 15 years after completion of study treatment.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Patients will receive one of the three doses of 3*10^5/kg, 6*10^5/kg,10*10^5/kg.

primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 28 days after T cell infusion
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of toxicity graded using National Cancer Institute (NCI) Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) version 4.03

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 3 months after T cell infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients in whom a response among complete response and partial response as defined by standard disease-specific criteria, will be observed.
Assessed using modified Lugano classification response criteria for lymphoma (2014) and NCCN clinical practice guidelines in oncology acute Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia（2018）

arm_group.description: Patients undergo leukapheresis. Patients will receive a lymphodepletion chemotherapy with cyclophosphamide and fludarabine 4-6 days before CART infusion. A dose of Quikin CD19-CART will be infused on day 0.

intervention.intervention_name: CD19-Specific Chimeric Antigen Receptor T cells with PD1 knockout
intervention.description: Autologous CD4+ and CD8+ T cells by gene-editing with both knockout of PD1 and also integration of anti-CD19 ScFv

overall_official.affiliation: the First Affliated Hospital, Zhejiang University

facility.name: the First Affliated Hospital, Zhejiang University
